# Truncated probability distribution 

Suppose we have a distribution with:

* probability function $F(.)$
* density function $f(.)$

Let $x$ be a random variable representing the truncated version of this distribution over the interval $[L,U]$ where: $-\infty< L < U < \infty$, we can define:

probability function of $x$: 
\begin{cases}
$F_{t}(x) = \frac {f(x)}{F(U) - F(L)}, if L \leq x \leq U$ \\
$0 otherwise$ \\
\end{cases}
